critique: The document establishes a commission to reconcile labor and management differences through collective bargaining. It aims to find ways the government can help achieve this goal and encourages labor and management to resolve disputes constructively. The commission includes members from labor, management, and the public, appointed by the President. Support and technical assistance are provided by the Departments of Labor and Commerce, and the Cost of Living Council. The document also abolishes the President's Advisory Committee on Labor-Management Policy.
